title: Groom says he misses pregnant wife being skinny in marriage announcement
text:
This guy is a keeper!!!!

A groom who planned his entire wedding as a surprise for his wife on a reality TV show has been slammed for his "selfish" decision the night before the wedding.

When most couples announce that they’ve just got married – it’s all about peace, love and mung beans.

The very last thing you expect to read is the groom slagging off his new bride.

But that’s exactly what happened when one newly married man announced his low-key ceremony at a registry office earlier this month.

The anonymous American groom wrote: "My WIFE and I got married today. I told y'all I wasn't playing with this relationship s***."

Ok, it could be worse at this point…

Then he attempted to get all mushy saying that his wife and baby Donte Jr "are a family that will not be broken".

Want to join the family? Sign up to our Kidspot newsletter for more stories like this

Appropriate emojis much?? Source: Facebook

And then comes the clanger...

Revealing how he and his now pregnant wife have been "best friends since before we started dating", he then has the gall to say: "She's getting so big. I miss her being skinny."

And then just when you think it can't get any worse he does a call out to previous former girlfriends ( who clearly had a lucky escape!)

"And to my exes... this could've been you but I'm glad it's not b*****."

The charming fella then ends his allegedly romantic post with: "OMG I cried y'all. We'll get rings soon - chill."

So naturally, it was only a matter of time before one of his Facebook friends screenshot his post, slapped emojis on their faces and shared it in the group That's It, I'm Wedding Shaming.

Wow - what a gentleman! Source: Facebook

"Can you say annulment?"

And rightly so - the guy was slammed and labelled "trash".

"Yo, he misses her skinny! He's about to be missing his head - holy s*** he better run when she sees this," one replied.

"If this post doesn't tell her he only married her to p*** off his ex, I don't know what well. HE WILL LEAVE YOU THE FIRST TIME HIS EX EVEN FARTS IN HIS DIRECTION GIRL," another warned.

"Could you imagine your husband telling you he 'missed you being skinny' as you're carrying his child," a third added incredulously.

While another got all facetious about the outrageous post: "C'mon guys. I'm sure this marriage was built on a solid foundation of mutual love, trust and respect and will last many years."

In response, one user quipped: "Can you say annulment?"
